dt: {bc}to make (someone) very happy and excited or elated

dt.t: It's a demanding dining experience that may exhaust and exasperate some customers, but {wi}exhilarate{/wi} those who desire a challenge more than comfort.
Uncle George tells stories … and {wi}exhilarates{/wi} everybody with his good humour and hospitality.
When antislavery senator Charles Sumner was honored in a demonstration that {wi}exhilarated{/wi} antebellum Boston, Louisa was there …

et: Latin {it}exhilaratus{/it}, past participle of {it}exhilarare{/it}, from {it}ex-{/it} + {it}hilarare{/it} to gladden, from {it}hilarus{/it} cheerful {ma}{mat|hilarious|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make (someone) very happy and excited or elated
